Package no.ntnu.idata.shiporganizer.shiporganizerservice.controller

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
no.ntnu.idata.shiporganizer.shiporganizerservice.controller.UserController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/user") public class UserController extends Object
REST controller for user actions.

      @GetMapping("/all-users") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<PublicUserModel>> getAllPublicUsers()

      ResponseEntity with a list of PublicUserModels

    • editUser

      Uses information about the user to enable editing a pre-existing user
      Parameters:
      entity - details about the user
      Returns:
      Response of ok if successful else an error response

    • getName

      @GetMapping("/name") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> getName(org.springframework.http.HttpEntity<String> entity)
      Gets the name of the user who owns the token.
      Parameters:
      entity - Http Entity containing user's bearer token in header.
      Returns:
      200 OK with name in body.

    • getDepartments

      @GetMapping("/departments") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Department>> getDepartments(org.springframework.http.HttpEntity<String> entity)
      Gets the departments of the user who owns the token.
      Parameters:
      entity - HTTP entity containing user's token.
      Returns:
      200 OK with departments as JSON array in body

    • deleteUser

      @DeleteMapping("/delete-user") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> deleteUser(org.springframework.http.HttpEntity<String> entity)
      Lets a user delete themself, or an admin delete any user.
      Parameters:
      entity - HTTP Entity.
      Returns:
      Response Entity.

    • sendVerificationCode

      @GetMapping("/send-verification-code") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> sendVerificationCode(@Param("email") String email)
      Makes the server send a verification code to given email to set new password.
      Parameters:
      email - User's email address.
      Returns:
      Response Entity 200 OK on success.

    • setNewPassword

      @PostMapping("/set-password") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> setNewPassword(org.springframework.http.HttpEntity<String> http)
      Sets a new password for the user using the received verification code.
      Parameters:
      http - HTTP entity.
      Returns:
      Response Entity.

    • checkValidVerificationCode

      @PostMapping("/check-valid-verification-code") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> checkValidVerificationCode(org.springframework.http.HttpEntity<String> httpEntity)
      Checks if verification code is valid.
      Parameters:
      httpEntity - Http request send from the client
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity 200 OK if valid.

    • checkRole

      @GetMapping("/check-role") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> checkRole(org.springframework.http.HttpEntity<String> entity)
      Returns the role of the user. ADMIN or USER.

      Security configuration is so that only authorized users, or admins can access this endpoint.

      Parameters:
      entity - Http Entity.
      Returns:
      200 OK with role in body.
